DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: Leandro D. Santana;SANTANA, LEANDRO D.;Leandro de Santana;de Santana, Leandro;DE SANTANA, LEANDRO D.;SANTANA, LEANDRO DANTAS;DE SANTANA, LEANDRO DANTAS

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: É Professor Assistente na Universidade de Twente (Holanda). Formado em Engenheiria Aeronáutica pela USP com mestrado pela mesma universidade e doutorado defendido na Universidade Católica de Leuven projeto desenvolvido em parceria com o von Karman Institute for Fluid Dynamics. Seus principais tópicos de pesquisa estão ligados ao ruído gerado aerodinâmicamente em aerofólios, e elemento aerodinâmicos rotativos (turbinas eólicas, hélices e ventiladores axiais) e ruído gerado em drones.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Is Assistant Professor in the University of Twente (Netherlands). Graduated in Aeronautical Engineering and Master of Sciences by the same university. PhD in Mechanical Engineering defended in KULeuven in a project developed in partnership with the von Karman Instittute for Fluid Dynamics. His major research topics are: airfoil noise, noise produce by rotating blades such as wind turbines, fans and propellers. Furthermore he is interested on the noise produced by unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) and drones.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Escola de Engenharia de São Carlos

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Aeronave silenciosa: uma investigação em aeronáutica
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto, inserido no âmbito do Programa de Inovação em Ciência e Tecnologia Aeroespacial (Picta), visa investigar e desenvolver soluções aprimoradas para o problema de ruído externo presente em aeronaves. Pretende-se atacar o problema segundo três abordagens distintas, mas complementares em aeroacústica: aeroacústica computacional (CAA), modelos analíticos e empíricos, e ensaios em vôo e em túnel. A síntese do projeto é o desenvolvimento de metodologias de análise que possibilitem estimar a geração e propagação de ruído em aeronaves. A intenção é agrupar uma equipe acadêmica e técnica que tem se envolvido ao longo do tempo com problemas de aerodinâmica e, recentemente, em acústica, e proposto soluções particulares segundo uma das abordagens citadas. O que se pretende agora é integrar esse esforço, é aprofundá-lo explorando a complementaridade dos distintos enfoques, é, em última instância, responder, da melhor forma possível, às questões suscitadas pelo problema de engenharia concreto associado à geração e propagação de ruído em aeronaves. Deseja-se explorar a complementaridade de visões que as distintas abordagens proporcionam. Como resultado prático desse esforço deve-se efetivar novo patamar tecnológico que assegure o desenvolvimento e certificação de aeronaves tendo como um dos focos o ruído externo de modo a atender a legislação vigente, com níveis de ruído competitivos para a classe de novas aeronaves a serem desenvolvidas, sem penalizar o custo operacional direto (DOC). Vale ressaltar que a integração das abordagens é inédita no Brasil e muito recente no cenário mundial. (AU)

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Leandro D. Santana;SANTANA, LEANDRO D.;Leandro de Santana;de Santana, Leandro;DE SANTANA, LEANDRO D.;SANTANA, LEANDRO DANTAS;DE SANTANA, LEANDRO DANTAS

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: AETHER - AERO-ACOUSTICAL AND THERMO-ACOUSTICAL COUPLING IN ENERGY PROCESSES
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
The AETHER project is a collaborative research and training network funded by the 6th Framework Programme of the European Commission in the frame of the Marie Curie actions. The project represents an initiative to strengthen the fundamental scientific work in the multi-disciplinary engineering field of aero- and thermo-acoustical coupling in energy conversion processes.
The network is composed of 6 universities, 3 research centres and 5 industries, which are all linked through their excellence in engineering energy conversion processes. The common denominator of the network partners is their long-standing expertise with combustion systems.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: AETHER - AERO-ACOUSTICAL AND THERMO-ACOUSTICAL COUPLING IN ENERGY PROCESSES

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Leandro D. Santana;SANTANA, LEANDRO D.;Leandro de Santana;de Santana, Leandro;DE SANTANA, LEANDRO D.;SANTANA, LEANDRO DANTAS;DE SANTANA, LEANDRO DANTAS

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: VON KARMAN INSTITUTE FOR FLUID DYNAMICS

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: IDEALVENT - Integrated Design of Optimal Ventilation Systems for Low Cabin and Ramp Noise
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Reaching low levels of cabin and ramp noise is crucial to ensure the satisfaction of aircraft passengers and a safe working environment for the crew and personnel servicing the grounded aircraft. From the passenger and personnel standpoint, good thermal and acoustic comfort is important to minimize both stress symptoms and tiredness. Required to provide satisfactory air quality and temperature, the Environmental Control Systems (ECS) currently used are key contributors to the acoustic nuisance within the cabin and around the grounded aircraft. Reducing the amount of noise produced by the ECS will therefore have a direct impact on the passenger satisfaction and personnel health and safety. Unlike aircraft exterior noise, which has received considerable attention in past and currently running research projects, the noise emitted by confined flows in ECS assemblies involves complex mechanisms that haven?t been sufficiently investigated to permit the noise reduction wished by passengers and regulators. Acoustic and hydrodynamic interactions between subcomponents have so far been largely neglected despite being crucial. Thorough experimental studies will be conducted in order provide a deeper understanding of these mechanisms. A combination of accurate scale-resolved methods with low-CPU cost statistical/stochastic methods will then be proposed as an original modelling and design approach. Integrated passive flow and noise control strategies will be explored both experimentally and numerically. The knowledge gained in the experimental and numerical investigations of the installation effects will permit devising and optimise strategies having the best potential for reducing ECS noise. The best noise reduction strategies will be finally tested on a full-scale ECS system, and their impact towards improved passenger comfort and airport personnel health will be assessed with respect to the objectives of the Work Programme and relevant regulations.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: IDEALVENT - Integrated Design of Optimal Ventilation Systems for Low Cabin and Ramp Noise

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Leandro D. Santana;SANTANA, LEANDRO D.;Leandro de Santana;de Santana, Leandro;DE SANTANA, LEANDRO D.;SANTANA, LEANDRO DANTAS;DE SANTANA, LEANDRO DANTAS

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: VALIANT - Validation and Improvement of Airframe Noise prediction Tools
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
The overall noise radiated by modern aircraft has two sources which are quite balanced at approach: the engine and the airframe. The airframe noise (AFN) has a broadband character and is mainly due to the interaction of the turbulent airflow with the high lift devices (slats and flaps) and landing gears, and to a second extent to cavities, spoilers and to boundary layers developing along the fuselage.
With the clearly expressed tendency of modern airframe industry towards virtual prototyping and the increasing reliability of the design cycles on numerical simulations with the experimental verifications performed only at later stages of the design cycle, it is of utmost importance to increase the trust in noise predictions. However, the complexity and diversity of broadband turbulent AFN sources makes that prediction and subsequent reduction with present numerical tools extremely challenging and far from mature.
VALIANT is tackling this challenge by generating new experimental data and validating and improving numerical tools for prediction of AFN generated from landing gears, slats, flaps and local separation regions.
Due to the extremely complex physical nature of the phenomenon and the high computational cost of computing full aircraft configurations on one hand, and a lack of a reliable experimental database on the other hand, VALIANT focuses on key generic test cases revealing the basic mechanisms of AFN generated by the most ?noise-dangerous? elements of a real aircraft:
* Turbulent flow over a gap * Flow past airfoil with flap * Flow past airfoil with slat * Flow past two-struts (landing gear).
These four generic flows actually ?cover? the most important sources of AFN generated by a real aircraft and therefore their study provides a sufficient basis for evaluation and improvement of the Computational Aeroacoustics (CAA) tools aimed at predicting AFN. On the other hand, these flows are ?simple? in the sense that their accurate
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: VALIANT - Validation and Improvement of Airframe Noise prediction Tools

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: BANDEIRANTES - Building A kNowleDge bridge by Exchanging Innovative Research and educational expertise between itA uNiversity of Twente Embraer and uSp
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Bandeirantes is the denomination given to the explorers who in the XVI century entered to the interior of Brazil and expanded the country borders to the limits that we know nowadays. The first Embraer airplane has been named Bandeirante due its unique capacity to bring people to Brazil?s most remote places and contribute to the country interiorization. Following this entrepreneurial exploratory spirit, this project will consolidate the knowledge bridge built to link top Brazilian top institutions and the University of Twente, more specifically, the Faculty of Engineering Technology (CTW). As strategy, this project has three main targets: 1) seed the long term academic collaboration between research groups through face to face and long distance meetings; 2) exchange bachelor and master students involved in research topics and projects related with CTW?s expertise; 3) profile strategic research topics developed in Twente such to instigate further state-of-the-art academic and industrial collaboration.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Trailing edge serrations for airfoil wind turbine noise reduction
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Trailing edge serrations and surface treatment will be experimentally explored in order to reduce the trailing edge noise produced by wind turbines.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Trailing edge serrations for airfoil wind turbine noise reduction

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Leandro D. Santana;SANTANA, LEANDRO D.;Leandro de Santana;de Santana, Leandro;DE SANTANA, LEANDRO D.;SANTANA, LEANDRO DANTAS;DE SANTANA, LEANDRO DANTAS

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Nature inspired serrations for wind turbine noise reductio
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Noise is the key constraint which determines the maximum wind-turbine diameter and rotational speed, parameters intrinsically related to the power production efficiency. In addition, the noise negatively affects the societal acceptance of wind farms close to cities. This research investigates the application of serrations (saw tooth like geometry) at the trailing edge of wind turbine blades. This research will particularly focus on serrations with a geometry inspired by the wings of the owl. The owl is a natural predator of the mouse, an animal with recognized good hearing, therefore only very silent owls can capture this kind of prey Recent research proved that serrations reduce the wind turbine noise and decreases the wake intensity [6], potentially reducing the interaction between turbines in a wind farm allowing, therefore, designers to minimize the separation between wind turbines and construct more densely populated wind parks.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Noise is the key constraint which determines the maximum wind-turbine diameter and rotational speed, parameters intrinsically related to the power production efficiency. In addition, the noise negatively affects the societal acceptance of wind farms close to cities. This research investigates the application of serrations (saw tooth like geometry) at the trailing edge of wind turbine blades. This research will particularly focus on serrations with a geometry inspired by the wings of the owl. The owl is a natural predator of the mouse, an animal with recognized good hearing, therefore only very silent owls can capture this kind of prey. Recent research proved that serrations reduce the wind turbine noise and decreases the wake intensity, potentially reducing the interaction between turbines in a wind farm allowing, therefore, designers to minimize the separation between wind turbines and construct more densely populated wind parks.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Nature inspired serrations for wind turbine noise reduction
